wikipedia_page.main:
John Nicholas Fazakerley (7 March 1787 – 16 July 1852) was a British Whig
politician.  He was Member of Parliament for Lincoln (1812–18),  Great Grimsby (1818–20), Tavistock (1820), Lincoln again (1826-30) and City of Peterborough (1830–41).

response: After the Newte tenure, in 1822 Duvale belonged to John Nicholas Fazakerley (1787-1852), MP Lysons, Samuel & Daniel, Magna Britannia, Vol.6, Devon, London, 1822 for Lincoln (1812–18),  Great Grimsby (1818–20), Tavistock (1820), Lincoln again (1826-30) and City of Peterborough (1830–41).
* Hon. Reginald Algernon Capel (1830–1906), who married Mary Eliza Fazakerley, daughter of John Nicholas Fazakerley of Burwood Park, in 1858.
